newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt Q3 96/97 BOP has 351.4 mln surplus.
newsitem.headline: Egypt Q3 96/97 BOP has 351.4 mln surplus.

text.p: Egypt's balance of payments had a surplus of $351.4 million in the third quarter of the 1996/7 financial year compared to a surplus of $709.1 million in the second quarter of the year, Central Bank figures showed.

The figures showed the 1996/7 figure compared to a surplus of $193.2 million in the third quarter of the previous year. The payments balance was $201.2 million in surplus at the end of the 1995/6 financial year.
The current account was $324.0 million in surplus for the third quarter of 1996/7 compared to $93.7 million in Q2 and $55.0 million in Q3 1995/6.
Following figures, all in millions of U.S dollars, were supplied by the Central Bank:
